dc:title: Day After Day - December 1942
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Discusses the objection that the Catholic Worker has made pacifism a precept, not a counsel like poverty, chastity, and obedience. Says over emphasis on authority leads to totalitarianism. Violent means will not bring forth an end result of peace.
